articles.content:
Solidarity with S. Korean farmers called for 
    Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- Sung Sang Sop, chairman of the central committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea, in a statement on January 15 expressed full support to the proposals set forth at the 2001 meeting for the independent reunification of the Korean nation, convinced that the proposals are very just and practical measures that enable the Korean nation to achieve its reunification smoothly by its own efforts at an early date in the spirit of the historic north-south joint declaration.
 He said that anyone who has the blood and soul of the Korean nation should unite firm under the banner of national independence and patriotism and turn out as one in a nationwide drive to implement the north-south joint declaration, irrespective of job, ideology and political view.    
 He laid stress on keeping pace with the South Korean farmers in firm solidarity with them in implementing the joint declaration to the letter.
